comment: Dr. Jackson was an okay professor. We met every Thursday and was strict about being on time. She never really explained assignments and after they were due she would then tell you what you should have done to complete it. There are not a lot of assignments but she is strict on late work. Even if it is an hour late you will still get 20 points off.

She is not a super harsh grader but sometimes directions are very unclear. We met once a week , thursday and assignments were due the next day with that being the only day we ever discussed the assignment. She takes a while to respond to emails.
I loved Professor Jackson! She was friendly and understanding. Gave extensions on assignments. I learned a few tips and resources from attending lectures!

Very easy grader, I got 100s on everything with the expectation of her seesaws, she def. jumps into her readings & assignments but she was my only class that I was able to finish my hours & assignments super early (in April). Easy A but I def. didn't learn anything or care to come to her class, she does have a ton of readings but it is manageable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: Dr. Jackson is so rude and passive agressive. She talks so quietly that you miss half the stuff she says. Just do your self a favor and avoid this class with her at all costs. So much busy work. Moves on to different assignments before you finish the first. Only way I got through this class is because of my group mates, NOT because of the teacher.

Rude and condescending. Preaches about us being professional but isn't toward us. Incredibly fast paced, soft spoken, and doesn't care that we are all very behind. Doesn't follow her syllabus. Grading and expectations are inconsistent. Make an obvious honest mistake turing in work? Oh well, bad. I hated every second of her class.

I loved professor Jackson! she had really meaningful lectures in class. I learned a lot from the in class discussions we had. You are expected to read the chapters at home and then she goes over it in class. There was four assignments and they were easy. Be ready to talk in class because she loves when everyone participates.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I loved professor jackson. I took her for ECE 3305 and 3330 at the same time. Her lectures are actually helpful and interesting. Her rubrics are clear and she is always accessible. She genuinely tries to make everyone's life easier and I really appreciate her for that. Solid choice!
Great professor .
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Dr. Jackson is a great professor and is willing to work with you if you have any questions or concerns.

She is okay. Her class wasn't too hard. She doesn't really answer the questions you ask, I think she means to but never actually ends up giving a direct answer to your question. She also doesn't mention that assignments are a thing until 3-4 days before they are due. That's not too much of a problem though because she lets you turn stuff in late
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Terribly rude. If I had to take her again it would not be pretty.
I really enjoyed taking her course. I love that we were given time to work on our group assignments in class. She was by far my favorite.
This class was not hard at all. A lot of group work though. Professor Jackson was nice but did not seem like she was into the class through the online platform.

This class was a lot online, however it is manageable. she is very knowledgeable about her class and things in the program. I got an A and this was my busiest semester of college. Solid choice. she does lecture ALOT though, 3 hours straight of talking, no breaks

Dr. Jackson did a wonderful job creating an interesting class through an online platform. She created teams and we collaborated with others, learned all about assessments and rubrics. She is so kind and easy to work with.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I would not recommend taking this professor. She got attitude with me several times over email, when she responded. I made a good grade in the class but agree with another comment that if you get with a bad group you pretty much get stuck with doing all the work. Dr. Jackson doesnt care if group members participate or not.

The ONLY professor that uses the strategies she is teaching in HER teaching. She was very effective. However, the work load for all of her classes is a lot. BUTT she will give you a good grade if you do it. She also provides feedback. You have to participate. Worst part was being stuck with a bad group for the whole semester, I had to 5x the work..
She is amazing! I truly enjoy taking her class as she is supportive of our learning and implements effective strategies to teach us the content of the class.

Dr. Jackson is very caring while teaching but outside of class lacks to respond to any kind of email. Her work is not that hard but her grading methods and practices arent consistent. Reconsider your options before taking
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Worst professor I have had at KSU. Does not know whats going on and was always distracted while going through her PowerPoint. NEVER ANSWERS EMAILS and has an attitude when she does. DO NOT TAKE
Dr. Jackson is a pretty decent professor. She actually cares about her students and provides lots of opportunities for group work, so it's pretty easy to get an A. Just don't miss any classes!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Dr. Jackson is really passionate about what she teaches. She provides detailed feedback on all assignments and I really appreciate her being so understanding. She created thoughtful activities that were relevant to coursework and helped us to get a better understanding of classroom application of the concepts leaned in this course.

She's nice but is not accessible outside of class. This made completing assignments on time difficult. She does offer extensions if you ever need one. With covid and everything, it was all online so I don't know how she is in person. There are a lot of assignments during this course.

I want to say we only really had 4 assignments. Two of which she assigned two weeks before school ended. She is not accessible outside of class. She answers emails on days she has classes. Other than that, you won't get an answer from her. It can be very frustrating especially if her assignments are confusing.

This class is a joke and she knows it. If you learn the difference between summative and formative assessments you'll basically pass the class. Every day felt like she was making up what we were doing as we went. Easy A.

This is my third class with Dr. J, and she was very different this semester. She would purposely talk very quietly when trying to get the class' attention then take off points for those still talking. It felt like middle school. She could be very harsh and seemed to make up things as she went along. Take Dr. Ritchie is he is available.

Dr. Jackson is intimidating when talking to the whole class, but when you talk to her one on one she is very sweet and really wants you to succeed. She also really prepares you for edtpa. She was kind of harsh at the beginning of the semester, but as the semester went on she lightened up. She takes awhile to respond to emails.

First off- I took her for online, so I have no idea how she is in person. But this class has been a breeze online. Very easy grader. She is hard to reach, as she usually takes a while to answer emails and sometimes never does. But I would take again!

She grades easy, but I would not take her again based on the atmosphere of the class. There is no energy, and she is often rude. She walks around with a clipboard and takes off points form your attendance/participation grade if you are not taking notes. But talking with her one-on-one is better.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: One of the greatest and nicest teachers I have ever had. Her assignments are hard, but she is extremely helpful and caring. Take this professer!
Honestly, she has impacted me in more ways than i can count. love her
Great! Loved her teaching style :) really sweet and is great for 3305. Would recommend.
Great lady!! So funny and sweet
I love this woman!! So great with dates and is the sweetest professor. Genuinely cares and will take her again!!! so funny
Great lady! Super sweet, cares about grades, and is flexible with dates.

Some parts of this class were helpful, but the workload was pretty large for having the class one day a week. The time spent in class was mainly her presenting powerpoints (which weren't that helpful) and her final didn't match most of the material we went over during the semester. Also if you're expecting quick responses to emails, think again.

Very poor professor. Does not know what she is talking about or the assignments. Reads from powerpoint that she doesn't even know the content of. My worst problem with her is that she DOESN'T ANSWER EMAILS. You can have a million problems and the best you're going to get is a mass response to the whole class that doesn't fully answer your question.

This class was 2hr 45 mins of her reading powerpoint presentations that she did not know the content of because she did not create or review them prior to class. She reads the slides word for word. There are hardly any interactions with your classmates due to lecture. She is unclear about requirements for assignments. I will NEVER take her again.

SO MANY POWERPOINTS!! This is probably your 3rd reading class. It's a review. She seemed surprised that we knew what she was teaching. It was 2 hours and 45 minutes every week of review. We were told we would have work days and never got them. Too much work and too much of a review!

Reads directly from the power point and restates the information as if she knows what she is talking about. About 2 hours of notes and 45 mins of pointless activities. She also doesn't know what the assignments are or how to explain how to do them.
